str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From a compound of hetoimazo and the base of poreia; to be good for passing through, i.e. have pecuniary means.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From horion; to mark out or bound, i.e. to appoint, decree, specify.
To send, transmit, permit to go, put forth.
Waiting at table; in a wider sense: service, ministration. From diakonos; attendance; figuratively aid, service.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: To dwell in, settle in, be established in (permanently), inhabit. From kata and oikeo; to house permanently, i.e. Reside.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Judea, a Roman province, capital Jerusalem. Feminine of Ioudaios; the Judaean land, a region of Palestine.
